title: Nightblue3 Intentionally losing games in silver
body: why is he allowed to do this? this is the same as intentional feeding. Is Riot aware that nightblue is doing this ?

replies.body: As a heads up, we're not allowed to call out people using their summoner name on the forum. This is to protect them from harassment.
You are correct but this rule didn't seem to apply to the Singed and Nunu support when they were being called out by name.
You are correct, and a mod clarified that they are more lenient when calling out popular players and streamers since they are already on Riot's radar.
those rules don't really apply to famous people and streamers.
Yes they do, that's like saying laws don't apply to celebs..
just that specific rule of "naming and shaming", everything else applies.
Well, to be fair, some of those laws don't really seem to apply. Lol
They have more public visibility.

Protect them from harassment ... sure...
But who is protecting their teammates?
Did he get reported? If he got reported he will go through the same process as anyone else. If everyone took the "OMG ITS NIGHTBLUE3!!!!!!!" and no one reported the behavior then he wont get banned.

He's doing money, and making free adverisement for riot, also he's such a shitty player that perpetrates this vicious cycle riot has masterfully crafted since they made the game, so he's getting one thousand birds with one pebble.

He's untouchable.

that's why he's doing it. check his op.gg the account he's been doing this on is nightbiu3

"Smurfing" in the sense of new account getting to appropriate tier is ok. Smurfing (losing on purpose to stay low) so you can then dominate completely ruins games. 
He is known enough that he should not be promoting this type of activity. And he knows better than to do this activity. I can understand if Riot would be "scared" that it might not actually be the same account, but man up Riot.
